item.title: Blocked road drains, 13th January
item.description:
Several blocked drains along this road cause flooding when raining.

item.description:
A large, sharp-edged pothole in the concrete road surface poses a risk of damage to vehicles. The pothole is often unavoidable due to parked vehicles.

item.description:
The potholes have been there for a while and they are getting deeper and more harder to avoid.

item.title: Pavement and verge destruction, 13th January
item.description:
A van or truck has driven along the pavement and verge leaving mud and deep wheel ruts all the way down the path and verge leaving mud if the posts were replaced they would not have to been able to do that please get them replaced
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Court Road, Poverest, Greater London

item.title: Street light panel broken exposing wiring, 13th January
item.description:
An internal panel has come off the streetlight on the road-crossing across Croydon Road (near to both Belmont Road and the main Croydon Road entrance to the Recreation Ground). Wiring is exposed and this may be an electrical hazard. Spotted on a morning walk 10am today.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 319, Croydon Road, Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pile of mattresses and otger flytipping, 13th January
item.description:
There is flytipping here on a daily basis. People bring vans and dump waste by rubbish chute on Woolstaplers Way. Please install cameras, permanent or temporary, to catch and prosecute those responsible. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10-30, Woolstaplers Way, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Heavy electric chairs outside someone’s bedroom window 22 Columbus Square this was reported last week, 13th January
item.description:
Too heavy electric chairs dumped outside bin show 22 Columbus Square, but it’s directly under someone’s bedroom window. The ladies is frightening in case someone looks in. Can you please get these removed ASAP?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Raleigh Close, Slade Green, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped stuff in shrubs, 13th January
item.description:
The shrubs here have lots of detritus, much seems to be shoplifted stuff from Sainsbury’s. It really needs a deep clean as the ground is covered in it and it’s looking awful

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Franklin Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 60cm pothole Northbound side of road past lamp post, 13th January
item.description:
The pothole is getting bigger every day and the whole wheel is dropping in, risk of tyre damage and people swerving around it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sherwood Road, Falconwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Narrow pavements blocked both sides of road, 13th January
item.description:
One side is commercial bin, other side is commercial bon & trucks that have been there for months. These pavements are used by anyone working down here or folks accessing businesses and services (e.g. sorting office).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pensbury Street, Clapham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Kentish Town rd, 13th January
item.description:
Over the past 20+ years Kentish Town road is always jammed and I wonder why it has not yet been sorted out. I take bus 134 and once we get to Kentish Town Rd it gets stuck for more than half hour, sometimes one hour!! This is utterly ridiculous and I want to know what are you doing about it as it’s been like this for over 20years!! I have to take the bus as I can’t afford the tube and I expect to get to work on time but this is becoming difficult and you got to sort out that road ASAP!!! It’s ridiculous and I wonder why there are always road work going on, again for the past 20years! What’s going on? Let me know thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, Kentish Town Road, Kentish Town, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Paper bank by Bromley South station left full., 13th January
item.description:
Paper bank by Bromley South station left full.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Old food waste all over pavement- slippery and smelly, 13th January
item.description:
The pavement which belongs to the council is disgraceful. There seems to have been food spilled over the pavement I guess from the bin. This has been like this for 2 weeks. There is also leaves and mud on the pavement and road. Making it slippery and dangerous for children. There is also wooden signs someone has put there saying temple car park but these are trip hazards at road crossing junction. This area really needs a good clean to make a nicer and safer environment for the school children who are as young as 3. This is not the schools responsibility as it is outside of the school on the council pavement and road. Further round needs a good tidy up too along the Lower road. You have 2 schools opposite for disabled children yet have let the are go to pot. We are working people and children attending school paying our taxes. We desserve a healthier environment. Please can this be looked into as an urgent matter. It’s so sad when I am teaching my child about litter and how to behave when this is the example she sees.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mitchell Close, Lower Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned, clamped van. Been here over a year., 13th January
item.description:
For at least a year a van has been left, clamped, and appears abandoned. It is falling further in to disrepair, and is now getting graffitied.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cornish Grove, Anerley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two damaged motorbikes, one bike part in the road the other blocking the pavement, 13th January
item.description:
Both bikes have been abandoned for at least 4 days. Also smashed glass in the same area.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Guild Road, Charlton

item.title: More bags dumped on the pavement, 13th January
item.description:
Corner of weir road again - Continually dumping bin bags and furniture - This was cleared yesterday and more has appeared today. The bag is clear with letters clearly visable - please can someone identity the culprit to stop this happening in the future. The wooden cupboard has been there for weeks now.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Weir Road, Bexley, Greater London

item.title: Stuff on pavement, 13th January
